item.title: Remembering The Sands: A Vintage Vegas Legend Demolished
item.description:
The Sands: Where Glamour and the Rat Pack Ruled

The Sands Hotel and Casino, a name synonymous with vintage Las Vegas, stood as a beacon on the Strip for over four decades. Opening its doors on December 5, 1952, as the seventh resort to grace the burgeoning Las Vegas Strip, it wasnâ€™t just a hotel and casino; it was a cultural phenomenon. Initially the brainchild of Jake Freedman, the Sands quickly established itself as a playground for the elite and a mecca for entertainment.
